content.description: SDS on a vertical rail. Climb up and right through interesting holds to a crux deadpoint move off a bad sloper.
content.location: Right of "Hera"

content.description: Start low in the diagonal crack. Bust a big move straight up to a jug, then continue up technical moves on small holds. The topout is a horrifying smear mantle 20 feet off the deck.
content.location: From The Odyssey wall, hike down hill then east keeping a slab wall to your left. After about 5 mins, you will see "Sunfisher" on the left. Continue past this for another few mins. and this looming wall will come into view.

content.description: Start on large undercling flake. Climb through the short roof and continue up the compression feature.
content.location: To the right of "Perseus"

content.description: Scramble up the ramp, then do several easy moves to a tenuous mantle that you wouldn't want to biff.
content.location: From The Odyssey wall, hike down hill then east keeping a slab wall to your left. After about 5 mins, you will see this wall at the base of the dome.

content.description: Start low on two good edges climb up and left through tenuous moves to a small right facing dihedral
content.location: Around the corner from "Buckshot" and "Side-by-Side"

content.description: SDS on obvious ledge under the roof. Climb up and left through compression moves, eventually reaching a technical seam.
content.location: Continue past the Odyssey wall to reach this area.

content.description: Stand start on diagonal rail. Several big moves lead up interesting holds.
content.location: Right of Flintlock

content.description: SDS on left hand sidepull, right hand on hidden horn. Climb the compression feature.
content.location: Continue past Buckshot and Side-by-Side for about 2 mins. to reach this small cluster

content.description: Start low in the diagonal crack on a jug. Traverse the crack to the left, then head up awesome granite features to a highball topout.
content.location: From The Odyssey wall, hike down hill then east keeping a slab wall to your left. After about 5 mins, you will see "Sunfisher" on the left. Continue past this for another few mins. and this looming wall will come into view.

content.description: Stand start on large sidepulls, then climb the arete, eventually topping out as for "Over Under"
content.location: Left of "Over Under" and "Side-By-Side". Continue past the Odyssey wall to reach this area.

content.description: Start on large jug. Climb straight up through rail and crack features.
content.location: To the right of "The Odyssey"

content.description: SDS on vertical rail. Climb up and left through a series of small crimps and underclings, eventually meeting up with the arete/crack or "Hera". Top out as for that.
content.location: Right of "Hera"

content.description: SDS on hidden left hand undercling, right hand sidepull. Climb the face
content.location: Continue past "Buckshot" and "Side-by-Side" for about 2 mins. to reach this small cluster

content.description: Start as for the Odyssey (on two good ledges near the center of the wall). Climb the first few moves to the first large rail, then traverse right to meet up with "Perseus." Top out as for that.
content.location: Center of the Odyssey Wall

content.description: Stand start on left hand undercling, right hand notch. Climb up and right through the sloper rail.
content.location: Left of "Side-By-Side". Continue past the Odyssey wall to reach this area.

content.description: Start on two good ledges. Climb directly up the center of the tall face using a series of rails and a small pod. Once at the high horizontal break, trend a bit right to reach easier terrain.
content.location: Center of the Odyssey wall.

content.description: Start matched in horizontal break. Climb more of the same to two mono pockets, eventually reaching a tenuous topout.
content.location: From The Odyssey wall, hike down the hill then east, keeping a slab wall to your left. After about 5 mins, you will see "Sunfisher" on the left. Continue past this for another few mins. and this looming wall will come into view.

content.description: Stand start on a jug (same start as Cronus), then climb powerful and tenuous moves up the diagonal crack.
content.location: Far left side of the Odyssey Wall

content.description: Start on large block, then climb the crack.
content.location: To the right of "Theseus"

content.description: Start on left side of the wall. Climb tenuous moves on vertical crimps up to the horizontal break. From here, traverse right to the slopey arete, then top out.
content.location: Continue past Buckshot and Side-by-Side for about 5 mins. to reach this wall. You can also continue walking east from "Red Ryder" for about 3 mins and this wall will come into view.

content.description: Sand start matched in the horizontal rail. Climb directly up through more of the same.
content.location: From The Odyssey wall, hike down hill then east keeping a slab wall to your left. After about 10 mins you will see "Red Forest". Continue past this for another few mins, then this wall will come into view slightly higher up the dome.

content.description: Stand start on jugs. Traverse the horizontal crack, then top out.
content.location: Far left side of the Odyssey Wall

content.description: SDS on low jug, using big blocks for feet. Climb through one very poor hold to a gradually easing crack system.
content.location: Right of Zeus Almighty

content.description: SDS on obvious ledge underneath the roof. Climb up and right through several good holds, eventually reaching a crux deadpoint to the lip off of a bad pinch.
content.location: Continue past the Odyssey wall to reach this area. It's just around the corner and up the hill.

content.description: Stand start on horizontal break, then climb the slab eventually using two very poor pockets.
content.location: Past the Odyssey Wall and left of "Side-by-Side"

content.description:
The most concentrated and developed area of Hagar Mountain. This zone features boulders from V1 to V10, with four or five star quality lines in almost every grade. The boulders here are all highball and the area feels very “out there,” so please use your best judgment. There is no easy way in or out.  

  Note: There is private property in the area. Please be aware of where you are hiking.
